title: Tilt-controlled home screen icon physics sandbox

requirements.text: Implement a single-page interactive simulation of a device “home screen” where a set of app icons can fall over and roll around inside the app when the user tilts their phone/iPad or moves an equivalent control on desktop.

quotes: make an app that make your apps on your phone fall over and roll around on the home screen when ever you tilt you phone or ipad or computer

acceptanceCriteria: The app renders a home-screen-like layout (wallpaper + a grid of icons) inside the web app UI.
When the device is tilted (mobile/tablet) or the desktop control is used, icons visibly tip, slide, and roll in the direction of tilt.
Icons remain constrained within the visible “screen” bounds (they do not disappear off-canvas).

requirements.text: Use device tilt on supported mobile/tablet browsers via DeviceOrientation (or equivalent) and provide a clear permission request flow for iOS/iPadOS when required.
acceptanceCriteria: On devices that support DeviceOrientation, the simulation responds to physical tilt.
If permission is required (e.g., iOS), the UI provides a button/flow to request motion/orientation permission and displays a helpful error state if denied.
If DeviceOrientation is unavailable, the app automatically falls back to a desktop control (see REQ-3) without breaking the page.

requirements.text: Provide desktop (computer) controls to drive the same tilt input without relying on device sensors (e.g., mouse drag to set gravity direction and/or keyboard controls), including a “Reset” action to re-center and re-stack icons.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, the user can change the effective tilt/gravity direction using on-screen controls (mouse/keyboard).
A Reset action returns icons to an initial neat grid and resets tilt to neutral.
The simulation remains performant and responsive during continuous input changes.

requirements.text: Implement lightweight 2D physics behavior for icons (gravity from tilt vector, collision against bounds, and icon-to-icon collisions with basic restitution/friction) sufficient to create a ‘fall over and roll around’ effect.
acceptanceCriteria: Icons accelerate in the direction of the tilt-derived gravity vector.
Icons collide with the screen edges and bounce/settle with visible damping (not perfectly elastic).
Icons collide with each other in a stable way (no frequent tunneling or exploding velocities under normal tilt).

requirements.text: Add a coherent, distinct visual theme for the app UI and apply it consistently (colors, typography, spacing, and components), avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The home screen simulation has a polished look with a consistent color system, typography, and spacing.
The chosen palette is not primarily blue/purple.
UI controls (permission, reset, desktop tilt control) match the same theme.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets for a wallpaper background and a small set of app icons, and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: The wallpaper and icon images are loaded from frontend/public/assets/generated (not served from the backend).
The simulation uses the generated icon images as the rolling/falling items.
Assets render crisply across common screen sizes (mobile/tablet/desktop).

constraints: Do not attempt to control or modify the user’s actual OS home screen; the effect must be implemented as an in-app simulation running in the browser.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook/entry paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose them instead).
nonGoals: Building a native iOS/Android app that alters the real home screen launcher behavior.
Multi-user features, persistence, or backend storage (not requested).
